attributes.title: Stock Take
attributes.description:
The stock exercise was conducted on 13 February 2025 to establish whether the internal controls were effective within the branch and to check if all the finished products and raw materials were matching with the system balances.

After stock take, it was noted that most stock items had nil variations with exception to bread stock which had a variance of +30.50 pcs, poly bags -47.90 pcs (cumulative) and Gunny bags 25kg and 50kg  which had a variance of -43 pcs and 39 pcs respectively.

Details of the findings were as illustrated in the table below
attributes.recommendation:
The branch management should ensure frequent stock take especially at the end of each shift so that the variation can be addressed.

BOM for materials especially flour should be revised to match the production quantities

Branch manager should be direct involved on counting and verifying of the gunny bags packed and sent to ingredients also the branch should improve on record keeping for gunny bags.
attributes.effect:
Effective control of raw materials and finished products were witnessed.

Weak controls on gunny bags resulting in significant variances.

value:
There is good control of stock items because we do regular stock take and follow up

The poly bags have minimal variation and they are okay.

Variations on gunny bags could be a result of recording and error on counting before sending to ingredients for we have received complain of sending either excess or less gunny bags.

We have a positive variance but we shall work on it, especially on the poly bags

The small variations on other raw materials are as a result of BOM variance and will be corrected

In the previous audit dated 07.11.2024. It was noted that the physical stock counted matched with the systems balance on almost all the stock items except poly bags which had a variation of -94 pieces, and bread stock which had variation of -114.50
Previous

attributes.title: Bread Weight
attributes.description: The bread that was ready for dispatch to the market on 14 February 2025 was sampled and weighed to check whether it had correct weight standards as per the Weight and measures act. The underweight is shown in the table below
attributes.recommendation: Branch management should consistent and continuous monitoring of the production flow to prevent cases of overcooled bread by flowing up and tightening supervision of workers to ensure set target are achieved and set standards are adhered to.
attributes.effect: Underweights should be discourage because it could expose the company to heavy penalties if caught by the weight and measures officials and also could lead to reputational risk hence loss customer’s as well as deny them value for their money.

value:
Underweight were caused by overcooling of bread due to jam caused by high production and oven inefficiency which resulted to high moisture loss.

We will put more controls to minimize cases of underweight. We are taking action to reduce the cases noted.

Underweight were caused by overcooling due to high production and slow speed of slicers.  

Supervisors should keep keen eye on slicers to ensure not bread is be accumulated on crates. Also we will conduct spot check on dough weight and packed bread to ensure that workers are complying with the set standards.

In the previous audit, showed high cases of underweight across most of the sampled varieties.

 The underweight were spread as follows; 200g W- 37%, 400g W- 24%, 600g W- 8% & 800g W- 16%.
Previous

attributes.title: Bread Damages Analysis
attributes.description:
The branch damages were reviewed for a period of 44 days from 01.01.2025 to 13 February 2025. The damages were analyzed to establish whether they were within the limit of 0.5% and 0.2% for market and production damages respectively.

From the analysis, it was noted that the overall production damages were 0.25% of bread produced while market damages were 0.30% of sales for the same period.

Below is the summary analysis.

                                                                                                                                            Table 1 Analysis of the production Damages

 

 

                                                                                                                                                Table 2 Analysis of the Market Damages
attributes.recommendation: Enhance controls within the production process to ensure bread produced is of good quality thereby minimize possibility of excess production and market damages.
attributes.effect: Excess production damages surpassing the set threshold is a loss to the company. The cost implication was Ksh.25,990.14

value:
Production damages were contributed by oven inefficiency and low quality flour.

Market damages were within the range and we will maintain the trendMarket damages were within the range and we will maintain the trend
Production damages were contributed by oven inefficiency and low quality flour
In the previous audit from the analysis, it was noted that the overall production damages were 0.25% of bread produced while market damages were 0.30% of sales for the same period
Previous

attributes.title: Analysis of Bread damages sent to ingredients
attributes.description:
Analysis was conducted on damages sent to ingredients department to establish whether damages sent matched with damages recorded on the SAP systems.

For the period 1 January 25 to 13 February 2025. We noted a significant difference between total damages at the branch level and damages sent to ingredients damages. Total branch damages were 4,583 pieces while those sent to ingredients plus damages in the branch on 14 February 2025 were 4,980.75 pieces, resulting in a variance of + 397.75  pieces of bread.

It was noted that damages were stored in an open store which was not locked. Therefore it was very easy to destroyer damages without the knowledge of the branch manager.

The table below illustrates the summary of the findings

Table 3 Analysis of the Damages sent to ingredients department
attributes.recommendation:
Excess damages sent should be recovered.

Branch should enhance transparency and avoid overstating of the damages. Is the responsivity of the assistant operation manager to check, verify and weigh damages before there are destroyed.

Damages store should reaming locked throughout.
attributes.effect: Variance of damages sent to ingredients and damages recorded on SAP systems is significant and this implies weakness in control where damages were being overstated. The revenue loss was Ksh.21,080.75

value:
Excess damages could be damages destroyed by workers without my knowledge and mix with other damages.

We will buy padlock to lock damages store also we will ensure damages recorded are verified before there are destroyed to avoid mismatch.
Excess damages sent to ingredients could be damages destroyed without branch manager knowledge or poor recording of damages
During the prior audit it was noted that damages sent to ingredients had a negligible variance of 2.90 Kgs equivalent to 7.25 loaves
Previous
Operations/Production Department

attributes.title: Mixing chart Analysis
attributes.description:
The mixing chart, mixing chart summaries, and cash flow were reviewed from 01.01.2025 to 13.02.2025 to check the average bags, the average yield, the utto consumption, the extent of the remixes, the figures transferred from mixing chart to cash flow if they are accurate and also to verify and confirm if the total finished product posted on the SAP was matching the mixing chart recorded at the production area. The following findings were noted.

v  Average production was 109.90 bags per day representing 56.36% of target which is195 bags per day (Branch Capacity)

v  Average yield was 190.16

v  Utto consumption was 100%.

v  No remix were noted over the audit period

The table below illustrates the summary of the findings.
attributes.recommendation: The branch should strive to ensure that they attain their target.
attributes.effect: Failure to achieve production implies the company never achieved the expected revenues.

value: The average production is due to low sales that prompt use to cut production.
The average production is due to low sales that prompt use to cut production.
Current

attributes.title: Cash Count
attributes.description:
An analysis was done in the cash office to verify whether the cashier had the sum amount that was expected to be in his possessio

The cashier was expected to have Ksh.70,035.00,but cash counted was Ksh.70,048.00. A variance of +13 shillings.

It was also found that there were two pending IOUs worth Ksh.8, 705 (Ksh.4,000 for packing fee & Ksh. 4,705 sales crew commission).
attributes.recommendation: The The branch management is encouraged to keep up with the cash control measures.
attributes.effect: Company’s money was adequately safeguarded.

value: Cash Controls are okay we will keep up
Cash Controls are okay we will keep up
It was noted that the cashier accounted for all the cash balance.It was noted that the cashier accounted for all the cash balance.
Previous

attributes.title: Production Efficiency
attributes.description:
The production efficiency was calculated for a sample period of a 44 days from 1 January to 13 February 2025. The aim was to establish if the branch was achieving the set production efficiency of 4.50 bags per production worker.

From the analysis it was noted that production efficiency was 4.35 bags per production worker.

Details of the finding were as illustrated on the table below.
attributes.recommendation: The branch should enhance controls to efficiently utilize the labour.
attributes.effect: The branch did not achieve the set production efficiency target meaning that the cost of production was above set budget

value: Production efficiency was contributed by shift cuts due to low sales
Production efficiency was contributed by shift cuts due to low sales
In prior audit production efficiency was found at 4.2 bags per production worker
Previous

attributes.title: Packing Efficiency
attributes.description:
Packing efficiency calculated with an intention of establishing whether the branch was achieving the set target of the 97 crates per slicers.

For 44 days from 1 January 2025 to 13 February 2025, it was found that the packing efficiency was 85.75 crates per slicer.
attributes.recommendation: Hiring of Packers shift wise should be guided by the number of bags produced in the prior shift. This will enable the branch to achieve set target
attributes.effect: Average packing efficiency was below the set target implying an extra cost of Ksh.71,136.00 incurred by paying 78 extra slicers.

value: Packing efficiency was affected by slow speed of slicers. We will try our best to improve the efficiency
Packing efficiency is low and we are working on continuous improvement to ensure this improves
In prior audit packing efficiency was found at 95.37% per slicer

attributes.title: Mileage Analysis
attributes.description:
The purpose of this audit was to assess and analyze the fuel consumption within the branch sales vehicle for the period 01.02.2025 – 16.02.2025. The primary objectives were to evaluate compliance with fuel efficiency standards, identify any areas of inefficiency, and recommend strategies for reducing fuel consumption and associated costs. The audit encompassed a comprehensive review of fuel records, maintenance logs, and related policies and procedures.

From the analysis it was noted that fuel consumption was well controlled with exception to two routes Chepareria and Kacheliba Routes which had over consumed fuel.

The table annexed at the bottom represents the analysis of the route vehicles.
attributes.recommendation: Fuel over consumption should be control to set standard and in case there is no change a retest should be done to determine actual rate of consumption
attributes.effect: Vehicle using more fuel than set standard implies that the company was incurring more than set budget.

value:
The two vehicles are operating on rough and hill road and this could have contributed to high consumption.

We will monitor fuel usage in the two routes so as to check if the set standard rate is achievable and then necessary action is taken

We have received complain of the two vehicles from the drives.  Complaining that the fuel consumption rate was high and requesting for fuel adjustment.

We will talk with KAF to do test to determine the actual rate of consumption.
